#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Create a Literary and Arts Magazine
#Text=Ever thought about creating a literary and arts magazine for your high school or college ?
#Text=Even just for fun ?
#Text=If so , this step by step process for creating a literary and arts magazine will be very useful to you .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Getting Started
#Text=Create a website or portal for works to be submitted .
#Text=Decide on content ( poems , short stories , art etc ) .
#Text=This may include hiring an IT person to help set up the site .
#Text=The IT person should include procedures for authors and artists to submit their works , along with username accounts for each member of the review team .
#Text=A reviewing and scoring system should also be created .
#Text=Get a group of people together to help create the magazine .
#Text=This may be in the form of a club or actual class .
#Text=Make sure to assign important positions to members of the Magazine team such as Editor in Chief , Assistant Editor , etc.
#Text=Once a team is assembled , start promotion !
#Text=Design flyers/posters to put up around your community or school campus .
#Text=Also think about creating various social media accounts for the magazine such as Facebook , Instagram , and Twitter .
#Text=This will get the word out to possible authors and artists who are interested in submitting their work .
#Text=Do n't forget to include a deadline for submissions and a link to the magazine 's website on the flyers and social media accounts !
#Text=That way potential authors and artists will know exactly where to submit their work .
#Text=Reviewing Content
#Text=Once works are in , start reviewing !
#Text=Make sure to give you and your team a couple weeks to do this .
#Text=Review each piece thoroughly so that it is given proper consideration .
#Text=Meet frequently with your club or class to discuss works with the highest scores .
#Text=These will probably be the ones chosen for publication !
#Text=While reviewing works , get in touch with a graphic designer who can create the cover and template for the magazine .
#Text=He or she is essential in bringing your vision for the magazine to life !
#Text=Also get an idea of the cost for printing and how many copies need to be made .
#Text=An experienced printing company will be needed for this .
#Text=Make final decisions !
#Text=Choose the works that will be published in the magazine .
#Text=Notify the authors and artists and possibly request brief personal biographies to be included in the magazine .
#Text=Have the editing team look over the chosen works for any grammatical errors .
#Text=Works should be proofread multiple times by each editor to ensure little to no mistakes .
#Text=The Final Stages
#Text=Send out final drafts of the short stories and poems , author bios , and editor 's note to the graphic designer .
#Text=He or she will place these into the finished magazine template .
#Text=Send to print !
#Text=Allow 1-2 weeks for the magazine to be printed prior to publication .
#Text=Celebrate !
#Text=This step is optional , but a nice party for the magazine team , authors , and artists is always a plus !
